intro: Whitia longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved whitia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are often hairy and have a distinct aromatic scent. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Whitia longifolia is native to southern Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal and medicinal properties.
